Returns: true if the activity was started with an ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE intent
isMultipleShare().Description: Returns true if the activity this reader was obtained for was started with an @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE_E@ intent. The Intent may contain more than one stream item.

Parameters: int: Index of text item to retrieve
getStream(int).Description: Get the URI of a stream item shared with the target activity. Index should be in the range [0-getStreamCount()).

Returns: An array of email addresses or null if none were supplied.
getEmailBcc().Description: Get an array of Strings, each an email address to BCC on this share.

Returns: An array of email addresses or null if none were supplied.
getEmailTo().Description: Get an array of Strings, each an email address to share to.

Returns: The calling application's icon or null if unknown
getCallingApplicationIcon().Description: Get the icon of the calling application as a Drawable if data about the calling package is available. Note: This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling application. As such it should not be trusted for accuracy in the context of security or verification.

Returns: true if the activity was started with an ACTION_SEND intent
isSingleShare().Description: Returns true if the activity this reader was obtained for was started with an @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_E@ intent and contains a single shared item. The shared content should be obtained using either the @B_android#support#v4#app#ShareCompat#IntentReader#getText_E@ or @B_android#support#v4#app#ShareCompat#IntentReader#getStream_E@ methods depending on the type of content shared.

Returns: ComponentName of the calling Activity or null if unknown
getCallingActivity().Description: Get the @B_android#content#ComponentName_E@ of the Activity that invoked this sharing intent. If the target sharing activity was not started for a result, IntentBuilder will read this from extra metadata placed in the intent by ShareBuilder. Note: This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling application. As such it should not be trusted for accuracy in the context of security or verification.

Returns: Count of text items contained within the Intent
getStreamCount().Description: Return the number of stream items shared. The return value will be 0 or 1 if this was an @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_E@ intent, or 0 or more if it was an @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE_E@ intent.

Returns: A URI referring to a data stream to be shared or null if one was not supplied
getStream().Description: Get a URI referring to a data stream shared with the target activity. This call will fail if the share intent contains multiple stream items. If @B_android#support#v4#app#ShareCompat#IntentReader#isMultipleShare_E@ returns true the application should use @B_android#support#v4#app#ShareCompat#IntentReader#getStream_E@ and @B_android#support#v4#app#ShareCompat#IntentReader#getStreamCount_E@ to retrieve the included stream items.

Returns: An array of email addresses or null if none were supplied.
getEmailCc().Description: Get an array of Strings, each an email address to CC on this share.

Returns: true if the activity was started with an ACTION_SEND or ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE Intent
isShareIntent().Description: Returns true if the activity this reader was obtained for was started with an @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_E@ or @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE_E@ sharing Intent.

Returns: Styled text provided by the sender as HTML.
getHtmlText().Description: Get the styled HTML text shared with the target activity. If no HTML text was supplied but @B_android#content#Intent#EXTRA_TEXT_E@ contained styled text, it will be converted to HTML if possible and returned. If the text provided by @B_android#content#Intent#EXTRA_TEXT_E@ was not styled text, it will be escaped by @B_android#text#Html#escapeHtml_E@ and returned. If no text was provided at all, this method will return null.

Returns: The subject heading for this share or null if one was not supplied.
getSubject().Description: Get a subject heading for this share; useful when sharing via email.

Returns: Literal shared text or null if none was supplied
getText().Description: Get the literal text shared with the target activity.

Parameters: Activity: Activity that was started to share content
from(android.app.Activity).Description: Get an IntentReader for parsing and interpreting the sharing intent used to start the given activity.

getType().Description: Get the mimetype of the data shared to this activity.

Returns: The calling Activity's icon or null if unknown
getCallingActivityIcon().Description: Get the icon of the calling activity as a Drawable if data about the calling activity is available. Note: This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling application. As such it should not be trusted for accuracy in the context of security or verification.

Returns: Name of the package that started this activity or null if unknown
getCallingPackage().Description: Get the name of the package that invoked this sharing intent. If the activity was not started for a result, IntentBuilder will read this from extra metadata placed in the Intent by ShareBuilder. Note: This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling application. As such it should not be trusted for accuracy in the context of security or verification.

Returns: The calling application's label or null if unknown
getCallingApplicationLabel().Description: Get the human-readable label (title) of the calling application if data about the calling package is available. Note: This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling application. As such it should not be trusted for accuracy in the context of security or verification.

ClassDesc: IntentReader is a helper for reading the data contained within a sharing (ACTION_SEND) Intent. It provides methods to parse standard elements included with a share in addition to extra metadata about the app that shared the content. Social sharing apps are encouraged to provide attribution for the app that shared the content. IntentReader offers access to the application label, calling activity info, and application icon of the app that shared the content. This data may have been provided voluntarily by the calling app and should always be displayed to the user before submission for manual verification. The user should be offered the option to omit this information from shared posts if desired. Activities that intend to receive sharing intents should configure an intent-filter to accept https:##developer#android#com@B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_E@ intents ("android.intent.action.SEND") and optionally accept https:##developer#android#com@B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE_E@ ("android.intent.action.SEND_MULTIPLE") if the activity is equipped to handle multiple data streams.
